Description: Extracting functional and non-functional requirements from natural language text
Identifying and categorizing entities (e.g., actors, objects, locations) in requirements text
Identifying the grammatical category of each word (e.g., noun, verb, adjective) in requirements text
Analyzing the grammatical structure of requirements text
Determining the sentiment (positive, negative, neutral) of stakeholders towards requirements
Identifying underlying topics or themes in large volumes of requirements text
Evaluating the complexity of requirements based on linguistic features (e.g., sentence length, vocabulary)
Identifying ambiguous or unclear requirements using linguistic features (e.g., vague terms, ambiguous pronouns)
Prioritizing requirements based on stakeholder feedback, business value, and complexity
Tracking the relationships between requirements, user stories, and test cases
RelevantScrumEntities: User Stories, Test Cases, Requirements Matrix

Description: Analyzing stakeholder feedback to identify patterns, trends, and insights
